topics.body:
God damn it, my mom just guilt tripped me with logic and well... guilt.

I can't get a scholarship for Arts so if I want that scholarship, I have to take something related to Engineering. And my parents are very pressuring me in taking Communications Engineering. FUCK, I DON'T THINK I'LL DO GOOD IN THAT AND ALSO I DON'T WANT THAT.

If I ever get a job, they want me to work at Telekom. They are seriously implying that I can't create something in the entertainment business and that if I ever join the entertainment business, they want me to be some software programmer or something.

I want to create! Why is that so hard to understand?!
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
Double post.
Shit.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f7f7c663687264157b0500#post_54f7f7c663687264157b0500
My money is on ceres becoming a waystation in 50 years to the outer solar system.

What I personally think will happen in the future for space travel is:
The moon will be a factory plant and waystation for space travel, ie you go into a orbital elevator to go to the moon to go to the rest of space; mars will take 200years to terraform; the asteroid belt will be the new main home to humanity with countless asteroids transformed into minicountries essentially; the dwarf planets beyond pluto becoming last stops to other solar systems.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f7f9a26368725ce02b0200#post_54f7f9a26368725ce02b0200
[bq="HJSDGCE"]God damn it, my mom just guilt tripped me with logic and well... guilt.

I can't get a scholarship for Arts so if I want that scholarship, I have to take something related to Engineering. And my parents are very pressuring me in taking Communications Engineering. FUCK, I DON'T THINK I'LL DO GOOD IN THAT AND ALSO I DON'T WANT THAT.

If I ever get a job, they want me to work at Telekom. They are seriously implying that I can't create something in the entertainment business and that if I ever join the entertainment business, they want me to be some software programmer or something.

I want to create! Why is that so hard to understand?![/bq]
Don't listen to them.  As someone that took 2 years of college in something I hated you'll only end up hating yourself and fucking up cause you're not good at it.

Look at Fafsa loans or pell grants; they're easy to do.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

I think I wanna be internet celebrity level famous. Like so I can go out and do normal things and maybe noticed by every one in several thousand  people but I could still go to cons and be recognized. 

I also wanna have a panel at a con one day. I have a theory that If you're a panel guest you can pretty much get a crowd to do whatever. I wanna see if I can get a room full of people to do the Macarena.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f7fb4d636872636cfb0200#post_54f7fb4d636872636cfb0200
[bq="uc9"]"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f7fb0363687263db830600#post_54f7fb0363687263db830600
The #1 fuckup parents make is that they try to live their lives through their children.

*If they like the degrees so much why don't they get it themselves?*[/bq]
This.
This is what my dad thinks many Asian parents should reflect on. You know the ones who often push almost unrealistically high expectations on their children? Trust me, it's not as much of a stereotype as you may think it is.
